reviews.title: Location, Location
reviews.text: For first time visitors to Nice you could not chose a better location. Overlooking the Promenades des Anglais whilst being next door to the old city makes this hotel a great choice. We had excellent service from the staff and although our room was not huge the view from the terrace was worth everything. I loved Nice and would recommend this hotel without hesitation for any first time visitor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a lovely room with a balcony and 2 chairs, amazing view...this is what makes staying here so pleasant! The room was clean and well kept, a little on the small side for 2 people to share.
reviews.title: Great views...pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As Rick Steves says, I would only stay here if you can get a room with a view...call ahead and make sure you get what you want. If you can get a room on a higher floor, I would recommend it, the traffic on the street below never ceases! The noise was not distracting though, even though we stayed on the 2nd floor of the hotel.
reviews.title: Romantic,Beautiful,and Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is well situated and it is an easy walk (or bike ride!) to many places, including the Promenade des Anglais, which is right across the street from the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic views at Hotel Suisse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service staff were polite and friendly...and yes the lift is tiny...you'll have to make multiple trips if you have more than one medium sized bag!
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected this hotel mainly because it offers superb views along the coast and is close to the old town. We didn't regret it. The views from our room and from the breakfast room were magnificent. The room was quite small but recently refurbished, and very tastefully finished. It was comfortable and had everything we needed, was impeccably clean on arrival and maintained that way through our stay. Breakfast was very good, both in quality and choice, but quite pricey, so we only took it in the hotel on days when we were starting out early; there are plenty of cafes offering good breakfasts at much lower prices, within 10 minutes walk. Overall an excellent venue. There is noise from the road outside but the double glazing kept most of that out, and even with the windows wide open we did not find it a problem and we could still hear the waves rushing up the beach. Our one minor gripe was that we had no hot water on two mornings when we got up early, but it was hot within half an hour.
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely wonderful! Room was quite small but it was VERY clean and modern. The bathroom was fairly spacious though. The views and location of this hotel are spectacular! The staff was also helpful and courteous. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great Place and great location and views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had read on trip advisor that the staff at the front desk was rude but I couldn't resist the location and view. The view was beautiful but the review was very accurate. I was appalled at the extreme rudeness of a young woman working the front desk. She spoke to me with complete hatred and condescension when having to assist me in any way. She looked at me with complete disgust and annoyance when I did not understand her directions the first time. It is unfortunate that someone has to live with such a bitter character.
reviews.title: Rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hotel Suisse after an absence of a few years. Since my last visit the rooms have had some soft goods renovations-new beds, mattress, flat screen tv and bathroom renovations. The french doors to the balcony have also been replaced with more sound proofed ones-so street noise somewhat lessened. Bathrooms also had some renovations. But the shower still gets water everywhere and there is some water damage already to the seal. But the real star is the location. Still superb room views. Not a luxury hotel. But very comfortable and friendly. I'll be back.
reviews.title: Great location, hotel has had some renovations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: location very good just at the edge of the old town. Friendly staff all very pleasant. Opted for a privilege room on floor 5 - room was quite small by europen standards but was ok. The room was very comfortable lovely bed and all looked very new. View form the balcony is superb you can see the whole way down the prom - only thing is there is no real privacy between the small balcony's - only a few bars separating them. There is excellent sound insulation from the outside as soon as you open the balcony doors you can hear the sounds from the beach but as soon as you close them you hear nothing. My main problem with this hotel was the paper thin walls inside and the noise from the cleaners and banging doors which started at 7.30am every morning - it was soo noisy and i had ear plugs in! The doors slam really loudly and you literally hear everything. If getting up at 7.30 am every morning suits then this hotel would be fine but not for me and i would not stay again for this specific reason especially at €150 per night! The hot water broke down on our first morning but was fine for the rest of the trip. Pity about the internal noises as everything else was good. Nice itself is nice but i reckon 2 days is loads to see everything.
reviews.title: Only ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here two nights while in Nice. We were traveling by train thru the countryside so we had to walk to the train station. Easy for us as we are in shape and travel light but it was a good 30 min walk, and that is without getting lost! The hotel is clean the people are inviting and the views from our 5th floor balcony were incredible. Free internet is a plus. Bathrooms were the largest we had in all our time in France. You do here other guests who might not be so quite but that can't be the hotel's fault. The elevator is about as big as a phone booth...We fit slightly sideways and only had one bag. Walk to old town is just a few minutes, I normally don't like to spend this kind of money on a room that we won't be in except at night but I would always make the exception if returning to Nice. We actually stayed in the room more just to sit and watch the waves. We didn't eat the breakfast but it looks like a lot of choices.
reviews.title: Splurge of a vew overlooking the water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel based on other reviews, and i agree with them all. Get a sea view room, it was spectacular. Walking distance to Old Nice (great dining there!). Staff were very happy to help with restaurant recommendations and reservations based on what were were looking for, as well as helping us navigate the public transport system. If you stay here just be aware there is no parking and parking is very expensive in Nice, but the hotel staff can help you get a long-term parking parking pass that is cheaper than you doing it yourself. Two small niggles was that the elevator is very small (2 persons or one and a suitcase), and slow so this made getting luggage up to our room a bit of a process. Also one of the days our room did not get made up until 4:45, and we were home from our day's outing by then so the lady did it while we were on the balcony enjoying some champagne. But once you see the view all that becomes insignificant.
reviews.title: Beautiful view, great location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the indulgent part of our trip, and we couldn't have been happier with our choice. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Arguably the best choice along the Nice Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is friendly, the rooms commodious, and the view is nothing short of fantastic. The location is at the edge of the Promenade des Anglais strip, and therefore does not feature quite as frenetic foot traffic as the rest of the coastline hotels do. Located just around the bend from the port area, therefore a quick, scenic walk from "the other" Nice. Just outside "old town" Nice and right next to the steps (and elevator) to the high point, the old castle ruins above Nice. This is a great hotel, and especially worth getting a room with a balcony.
reviews.title: #1 position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the other reports are accurate regarding the position and the views. Just superb.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel when I was in Nice 10 years ago. Even back then it was a very good hotel that wasn't quite as expensive as some of the others you'll find in Nice. Now...fast forward to 2010. The hotel has undergone quite a number of renovations, however, the fantastic views that you get when staying at this hotel, still remain. Check in was smooth, and although the girl at the front desk spoke perfect English, she allowed me to try my best to get through check in, solely in French. We booked the suite in the hotel (Chambre 42), and it was perfect for our needs. Two separate bedrooms with a large shared bathroom that is accessed in a common area in between the two bedrooms. Both had balaconies, as do almost all the rooms at this hotel. The view is breathtaking. Try and get a room on the 4th or 5th floor, as this is where the best views are found. One night, I lost my BlackBerry on a train coming back from Monaco, and the gentleman at the front desk could not have been more accommodating to me. He looked up my service provider's phone number on his computer at the front desk and even called North America for me, so I could talk to them directly and cancel my service. The cabs they called for showed up right on time and were very fairly priced. As mentioned by other guests, try to avoid the breakfast - there are just too many wonderful places close by that will not be quite as expensive. The only negative in this hotel is the elevator. It is a little tiny box that only two people can squeeze into. If you are claustrophobic, or impatient to wait for the one elevator that the hotel has, you can easily take the stairs and get some exercise. Be warned - this hotel is a 3 star property, and although spotlessly clean, it is basic compared to luxury hotels. Nevertheless, overall this hotel is a great find, and I recommend it highly to anyone travelling to Nice.
reviews.title: Great Service, Great View, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the Suisse Hotel in a privelege room. The view from the balcony was absolutely magical and we had to drag ourselves away to go exploring and see Nice. We paid hansomely for the privelege room but the view was worth it. The room itself was ordinary and very small and the amenities provided by the hotel clean but basic. The hotel itself is a rabbit warren of rooms and built into the cliff. obviously there is a limit to modernising such an old establishment. Wifi acces was promised in the foyer but it was very slow and unpredictable. breakfast is available but it is much better to eat in one of the cafes or resturants in the Old Town adjacent. The hotel has an agreement with the private beach proprietors at the closest beach where guests can go for a daily fee. We didn't use that service so can't comment.
reviews.title: magical location, old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are old castle ruins adjacent to the hotel and great lookouts over the town and surrounding area.
reviews.title: Room with a View
can't wait to return
reviews.text: We found lots of places to eat, especially the ice creamery, in the Old Town and one evening walked around to the harbour to exoplore the restuarants there (as well as the eyepopping yachts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting around Nice is easy. There is a local tram but you need plenty of coins for the fare machine as it won't accept foreign credit cards and can be tempramental re cash. The bus to Monaco is only 2 euro each way and excellent value for money for a quick visit to another location. The trip takes about 40 mins.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the hotel was clean and had a good location, it wasn't very special. I think their best feature is the view from the balcony, of which they gave us a room with a palm tree blocking it. They did switch rooms for us, but not without a bit of attitude. Front desk wasn't very friendly, but thats ok, we didn't need much.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a wopping 17e, not at all worth it, skip it. We were so jetlagged and up ready to eat at 4am that we took breakfast the first morning just for convienience, but we skipped it the next day, you are very close to bakeries and other restaurants.
reviews.title: Superb for a Cote D'Azur Mini Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Easy to book, competitive prices, amazing location (RIGHT by the beach and old town), superbly clean, efficient and professional staff. Very close to the buses, trams and trains so a good hub from which to explore Cannes, St Tropez, Antibes and Monaco as well as Nice. Only thing we didn't do was pay 14 Euros for breakfast as I think that is too steep.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel has the most amazing views, according to the locals to whom we spoke, the best view in Nice.
reviews.title: If only the staff could display more warmth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are not large but spend the extra and ask for a room on the 4th floor or higher with an sea view and balcony and you will be delighted.
reviews.title: Great location and helpful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The best thing about Hotel Suisse is the location. The hotel is near the old city. The view from the rooms is spectacular. It is near the harbor and bus stops. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and the front desk staff were very cordial. The rocky,but gorgeous beach is directly across from the hotel. Ou room was large and very comfotable. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned after a 2 week trip to France and the Hotel Suisse in Nice was the last place we stayed. I agree the view and location is great but it didn't make up for how poorly the staff treated us. We wanted to splurge on a superior room with a view given it was our final couple of days. The room was just average but as the reviews indicated, definitely worth the view. We were put in a room with a major leak from the bathroom sink and when we called to inform the staff of the problem, were told they didn't have any comparable rooms and we were expected to pay more. After a long discussion we were given a much smaller room (same price) after suggesting we stay in the room with the leak.
reviews.title: Location wasn't enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The issues with the room did not come close to the problem we had when checking out. We were charged for more than originally told and they made a "mistake" and charged for an additional night. They insisted the amount was correct even when I got them on the phone with my bank. I nearly missed my flight trying to get it resolved and I'm spending time on my first day home still dealing with the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: I would never return to this place after the horrible way the staff treated us, definitely not worth it.
reviews.title: Perfect!!! You really couldn't ask for anymore ( unless you're unreasonable)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are going to Nice you may as well have a sea view and the one from this hotel is among the best - all along the Baie des Anges - particularly stunning at sunset and at night.
reviews.title: Great Hotel / Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our one night stay here. It was at the end of a week long tour of the Cote D'Azur. The hotel location at the end of the Promenade Des Anglais made it very convenient for exploring the Old City, the Cours Saleya and the Christmas Village, and the sunset view from our 4th floor room was amazing. The room was comfortable and the hotel staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Very convenient
Perfect end to 2 weeks in France
reviews.text: The hotel's elevator was very small so we had to make two trips with our luggage, and the walls seemed to be very thin as we could hear the people next door clearly, but that's why we travel with a sound machine to drown out noise. We didn't get the chance to try the restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We got great value for the money since it was off season and we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location and view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here as the last stop in a 2-week trip from Paris south to Nice. A perfect end to the trip. The hotel is wonderfully situated close to the old quarter, with a view over the bay, and backing up to a hilltop park. Our room was clean, roomy enough, and plenty quiet for us. For us this was a splurge - for my money the best ocean-view hotel in Nice - and well worth it.
reviews.title: Nice location but a bit disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the rooms on 4th floor facing the ocean with excellent view.
reviews.title: Great location, newly renovated rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, a room with a stunning view over the Promenade des Anglais 30 degrees end of November.
reviews.title: Best location in Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rooms are tiny but confortable at least for a short stay. Appreciate the balcony where one can sip a glass of champagne looking over the sea and the beach up to the airport...
reviews.title: Perfectly located hotel on the promenade in Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one nite only but the kind of ones to remember! Front office staff very pleasant and helpful.Only problem seems to be parking space.
reviews.title: Wonderful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in a superior room on the fourth floor at the front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic location and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room had an awkward shape and layout. It was at a diaganol to the window, with the bed facing away from the window. Unfortunately this meant that, despite the window opening out onto the promenade, you were not able to enjoy the view from most of the room as the window was at the narrow corner of the bedroom.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in very good Location
